elements.title: Céline Dept (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Céline Dept (pictured) was the first Belgian YouTuber to reach 10 million subscribers?

elements.title: Operation Matterhorn logistics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Operation Matterhorn logistics involved the construction of airfields in China by thousands of laborers with hammers and wicker baskets?

elements.title: Zheng Haohao (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after qualifying for the 2024 Summer Olympics at the age of 11, skateboarder Zheng Haohao became the youngest Chinese sportsperson to participate in the Olympics?

elements.title: Mariesa Crow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that electrical engineering professor Mariesa Crow raises alpacas?

elements.title: medals at the 1964 Summer Olympics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Larisa Latynina became the most-medalled Olympian after she won six medals at the 1964 Summer Olympics?

elements.title: her debut album (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that South African singer Tyla delayed her debut album's submission date in order to collaborate with Tems?

elements.title: Jenya Kazbekova (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jenya Kazbekova, a competition climber on the Ukraine's 2024 Olympic team, is the daughter and granddaughter of competition climbing medalists?

elements.title: The boys of Pointe du Hoc (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when delivering his speech "The boys of Pointe du Hoc" on the 40th anniversary of the Normandy landings, Ronald Reagan addressed 62 veteran service members present on D-Day?

elements.title: McVey Fire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after the McVey Fire, the United States Forest Service accidentally planted thousands of acres of non-native trees?
